intro: Pseudopentameris macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered star-sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and clustered, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Pseudopentameris macrantha thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
